item.description:
PLEASE -- TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. By signing up you have agreed to our GROUP GUIDELINES.


EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Please contact me here with your thoughts and ideas about this trip: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882. PLEASE -- no calls except for day-of scheduling issues. You can text me as well. This event is scheduled as a weekend visit to northern Vermont that also includes a hike over North Jay, Jay Peak and Big Jay.


A fall view of Camel's Hump from the summit of Mansfield.



ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

Difficulty: About 7.4 miles, about 2,000 feet total vertical climb. At 1.5 miles per hour average, this hike should not take longer than five hours, plus summit time.

Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the meetup location to the Elmore State Park camping area where we can camp; then to the Monroe trailhead / parking area on Camel's Hump Road, southwest of Waterbury, VT. USE THE COMMENTS FIELD TO ARRANGE CARPOOLS.


Hike Start Time: 9 a.m.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items. Wear multiple synthetic layers to adjust for colder fall temperatures.


DETAILS / UPDATE (08/12/2010 1 p.m.):
This is a cross-posted trip with Hiking Mates CHALLENGE, the Hudson Valley Hikers, the New England Hiking Meetup, Hike/Snowshoe Vermont, and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group. We'll set up a camp at the Elmore State Park for Friday and Saturday night.


This is the second time I've visited Camel's Hump; the first time was completely socked in, so I'm looking forward to the beautiful views promised by other visitors to this very popular Vermont 4,000-footer. At 4,083' ASL, Camel's Hump is on both the "Northeast 115" and "New England Hundred Highest" climbing lists.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Camping Information:
LINK: The Elmore State Park, where we'll arrange for camping for attendees Friday and Saturday night. NOTE: IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN CAMPING, RSVP AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AND INDICATE YOUR INTEREST IN CAMPING -- SITES WILL BE LIMITED DURING THE FALL "LEAF-PEEPING" SEASON.

Camel's Hump:
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: MountainZone
LINK: New England 4,000 Footers
LINK: Dartmouth Outing Club

CLICK HERE FOR A MAP OF THE ROUTE -- PRINT AND BRING WITH YOU!

A fall view from the summit.



See you there! Julie.


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES: Fall on Vermont's Camel's Hump
